Here’s Our List of Eats for Every Kind of BudgetBy Las Vegas April 24, 2018FacebookTwitterEmailFacebookTwitterEmailLas Vegas is a fantastic food city, plain and simple. With many celebrity chefs boasting multiple restaurants in town, underground cult-hits, and local low-key favorites—Vegas is right up there on the list of culinary hot spots. If you’re planning a visit, take a look at some our latest favorites for every type of budget! Go forth, get hungry, and make a stop at these Las Vegas gems.Treat Yourself to an Epic Tasting Menu with One of the World’s Most Renowned ChefsErik KabikThe ultimate in fine dining is available for culinary connoisseurs at French Chef Guy Savoy’s only namesake restaurant in the U.S., located in Caesars Palace. His menu features delicate, acclaimed French masterpieces made famous at his original Paris location. Ready to splurge? Enjoy the Prestige Tasting menu for a cool $385 per person. Wine pairings are additional but definitely recommended for a culinary experience not soon forgotten.What to order: The Prestige Tasting menu includes mouthwatering dishes like langoustine with dashi, hibiscus, and osetra caviar along with the famous artichoke and black truffle soup served with toasted mushroom brioche and a black truffle butter.Make a Date for This Casual and Delicious Latin-American FeastChicaWho doesn’t love a night of sharing small plates and Latin fusion fare among friends? Chica, at The Venetian Las Vegas, features chef Lorena Garcia’s robust and vibrant flavors from Venezuela, Peru, Brazil, Mexico, and Argentina, among many others. Her diverse menu puts a spin on classic renditions of Latin American cuisine, so bring your friends and make a date of it.What to order: The grilled Peruvian octopus served with crispy quinoa, ají amarillo sauce, blistered shishito peppers and a spicy guasacaca pico is a menu highlight. Also don’t miss the spicy chile-lime shrimp tacos that come with habanero aioli and cucumber mango topped with pickled vegetables and black beans.Head Off the Strip for Refined Italian Fare in the RockiesStation CasinosAcclaimed chef, author, and restaurateur Scott Conant has created a soulful Italian dining experience that will impress even the most discerning palates. Masso Osteria is located off the Strip in the Red Rock Resort, Spa & Casino. The restaurant offers refined Italian fare in a lively environment. Chef Conant is praised for his house-made pasta, so put that on your list, along with spins on traditional antipasti and savory wood-fired sides. This kind of dining is perfect for a group or special occasion, so go ahead and order a bunch of dishes for the whole table to share.What to order: Try the wood-roasted prawns that come with a rich, Calabrian chili butter and couscous or the vibrant squid ink rigatoni with spicy king crab, calamari ragù, and tomatoes.Try a Variety of Dishes at This Authentic Thai Off-Strip FavoriteAlex LauAmazing Thai food in Vegas? You bet. We’re big fans of the original location, but Lotus of Siam just opened a second spot in town that’s just as good. Good bang for your buck here, so go with a crowd to try a bunch of their Issan (read: Northern Thailand) favorites. With authenticity comes some serious heat—but don’t worry, if you can’t handle a five-alarm mouth fire, you can adjust the spice level on their in-house scale of 1–10.What to order: The khao soi, a fiery coconut curry broth, packed with chewy egg noodles. Don’t miss the homemade Thai sausage sai oua, a Northern Thai specialty.Indulge In the Kind of Dinner Party Dining You’ll Dream AboutAnthony MairFans of Chef David Chang’s unique culinary style can rejoice as he’s now opened his very first Momofuku restaurant located in The Cosmopolitan of Las Vegas. While many may know his menu to feature dishes with influences from around the world, it’s the true foodies who know where some of the best items come from. Our favorites? All in the large-format meals perfect for sharing with the table. Yes, please.What to order: Go for the slow-roasted pork shoulder accompanied by oysters, rice, Bibb lettuce, kimchi, hoisin, ssäm, and ginger scallion sauce. There’s also a whole rotisserie duck served with the leg confit over rice with Bibb lettuce, chive pancakes, kimchi, and a variety of stellar sauces.Recipes you want to make.
